details.title: Latest scenes from Ramlila Maidan
details.content:
Delhi: #Visuals from Ramlila Maidan on the second day of 2-day protest by farmers from all across the nation, who are asking for debt relief, better MSP for crops, among other demands pic.twitter.com/Awkh9uwIbh

— ANI (@ANI) November 30, 2018

Students, lawyers, doctors - were among the various section of the society who on Thursday extended their support to farmers during their rally with food, water and medical care. [READ THE FULL STORY HERE]

details.title: Delhi Police make elaborate security arrangements for the rally
details.content:
All necessary arrangements have been made at Ramlila Ground.

Central District: 

850 Police personnel up to the rank of SIs
12 Companies including 2 of women.
95 officers from the rank of inspectors to Addl DCsP

New Delhi District:

346 Police personnel up to the rank of SIs
600 from other districts.
9 Companies Outer force
71 officers from the rank of inspectors to Addl DCsP

Total:

1796 Police personnel up to the rank of SIs
21 Companies Outer force including 2 Companies of women.
166 officers from the rank of inspectors to Addl DCsP
In addition Special Reserves have been kept at important Police Stations. 
Arrangements will be supervised by Spl. CsP/ North & South and Jt.CsP/Ranges

details.title: Farmers vent out anger against Modi government
details.content: “If we have the power to elect the Prime Minister, we also have the power to bring him down. Our condition has gone from bad to worse in the last few years. Despite the government’s tall promises, it gave us nothing,” warned Om Prakash from Uttar Pradesh. [READ THE FULL REPORT HERE]

#FarmersMarch | "Bring the government down," say protesting farmers at the #RamlilaMaidan in Delhi. @SanskritiTalwar reports LIVE from the venue.#DilliChalo pic.twitter.com/bPXrTICTEI

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) November 30, 2018

details.title: Latest scenes from Ramlila Maidan
details.content:
Delhi: #Visuals from near Ramlila Maidan on the second day of 2-day protest by farmers from all across the nation, who are asking for debt relief, better MSP for crops, among other demands pic.twitter.com/j145x5uhc7

— ANI (@ANI) November 30, 2018

details.title: Delhi Police says will inform about traffic situation through social media
details.content:
Jt. CP(Traffic) on farmers' protest in Delhi: Traffic police will give real-time updates on FB&Twitter of affected traffic routes. Commuters are advised to stay updated.Around 1,000 traffic personnel have been deployed in all these routes to plan diversions&to keep traffic smooth pic.twitter.com/sxKlvxDsNU

— ANI (@ANI) November 30, 2018

details.title: Latests visuals from the march
details.content:
#KisanMuktiMarch pic.twitter.com/MUKJm29RpA

— AIKS (@KisanSabha) November 29, 2018
The protesting Farmers are now crossing Ranjit Singh Flyover in New Delhi.

details.title: Watch the video of farmers' agitation
Kejriwal, Sharad Pawar, Farooq Abdullah to expected to attend the rally
details.content: As per sources, Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal, NCP chief Sharad Pawar, National Conference leader Farooq Abdullah,Loktantrik Janata Dal’s Sharad Yadav are expected to join the farmers' rally to Parliament Street.

details.title: Rally reaches Parliament Street
details.content: Protesting farmers reach the Parliament Street

details.title: Delhi Police Latest Traffic Alert
details.content:
Traffic Alert

अखिल भारतीय किसान संघर्ष समन्वय समिति मार्च अब संसद मार्ग पहुच चुका है रामलीला मैदान ,जवाहरलाल नेहरु मार्ग ,रणजीत सिंह फ्लाईओवर ,बाराखंबा चौक टॉलस्टॉय मार्ग,कस्तूरबा गांधी मार्ग ,टॉलस्टॉय मार्ग-जनपथ क्रासिंग ,जंतर मंतर T-Point पर यातायात अब सामान्य है |

— Delhi Traffic Police (@dtptraffic) November 30, 2018

details.title: Delhi traffic goes into tizzy
details.content: Traffic was affected on the Jawaharlal Nehru Marg, on the stretch near Guru Nanak Eye hospital, Maharaja Ranjit Singh flyover, Barakhamba Chowk and Janpath on Friday morning  (Read full story here)

details.title: Umar Khalid criticises Modi Government over farmers' plight
details.content:
#FarmersMarch | "At least two farmers are committing suicide every hour in India. But It's a shame that farmers have to get to the streets to raise their voice for their rights. Government is still not doing anything about it," said youth leader @UmarKhalidJNU.@SanskritiTalwar. pic.twitter.com/TxpNr7Tv6X

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) November 30, 2018

Traffic Alert

Breakdown truck removed and traffic is normal from Mukandpur Village towards Outer Ring.

— Delhi Traffic Police (@dtptraffic) November 30, 2018
Farmers raise slogans against government at Ramlila Maiden

CPI (M)'s Sitaram Yechury at farmers’ protest in Delhi: BJP, Modi & RSS have only one weapon in hand that is Ram Temple. As the elections are approaching, they have started chanting ‘Ram Ram’. pic.twitter.com/D3Ht1rOeuT

— ANI (@ANI) November 30, 2018

details.title: Agriculture is India's backbone: Former PM H D Devegowda
details.content:
Modi Government and BJP are boasting about betterment of India's position in the 'Ease of Doing Business' index. But, with 'Ease of Doing Business', India should also better itself in 'Ease of Doing Agriculture'. This is very important @narendramodi avare.#FarmersMarch

— H D Devegowda (@H_D_Devegowda) November 30, 2018

details.title: Rahul Gandhi joins farmers’ protest in Delhi
details.content: If the loans of industrialists can be waived off, then the debt of farmers must be waived off as well. I assure the farmers of India, we are with you, don't feel afraid: Rahul Gandhi
Farmers being cheated of fair prices, they are not beggars, says Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal at Kisan rally.
Arvind Kejriwal at farmers’ protest in Delhi: Five months are left, I demand that the Central Govt implement Swaminathan report.

details.title: Rahul, Kejriwal on same stage is nothing but drama and confusion, says BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra
details.content:
राहुल गांधी और अरविंद केजरीवाल एक ही मंच पर है, इसका एक ही अर्थ है - ड्रामा और कन्फ़्यूज़न एक ही मंच पर है। देश की जनता ने इनका साथ छोड़ दिया है इसीलिए इनके एक साथ आने से कुछ नहीं होता - डॉ @sambitswaraj pic.twitter.com/vFaeBtyYTE

— BJP (@BJP4India) November 30, 2018

#WATCH Former J&K Chief Minister Farooq Abdullah speaking at farmers' protest at Jantar Mantar,New Delhi pic.twitter.com/JpdhBgea82

— ANI (@ANI) November 30, 2018
Protesting Farmers at Kisan rally in New Delhi. (Photo | Parveen Negi/EPS)

Expressing solidarity with the farmers, who were staging a march in New Delhi seeking debt relief and better MSP, DMK President M K Stalin on Friday urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi to listen to their pain and work towards long term solutions. 

Thousands of poor farmers from across India are marching in Delhi seeking debt relief & better MSP. Tamil Nadu farmers are facing the same plight.

I urge PM @narendramodi to listen to the pain of these farmers and work towards long term solutions.#FarmersMarch#KisanMarch pic.twitter.com/o5PoOGuNko

— M.K.Stalin (@mkstalin) November 30, 2018

details.title: We are with farmers, farmers will get justice: Rahul Gandhi
details.content:
किसान देश पर भार नहीं हैं।
किसान देश का सार हैं|

देश का किसान संकट में है|
उनकी उम्मीद टूट रही है।
उनके दिल में दर्द है।

हम किसान को अकेला नहीं छोड़ सकते।

चाहे कानून बदलना पड़े, सरकार बदलनी पड़े या प्रधानमंत्री बदलना पड़े, हम किसान का साथ देंगे। किसान के साथ न्याय होगा। pic.twitter.com/uiZ9lyCgET

— Rahul Gandhi (@RahulGandhi) November 30, 2018

details.title: Watch why farmers from South India went to the Capital
WATCH: Why Kisan rally Matters?

details.content: Social activists and political leaders slammed the Union government Friday, alleging it has not implemented a "single major initiative" for farmers in the past four and a half years and that demonetisation worsened the agrarian distress in the country, reports PTI.
